Burma: Surrender of the Yongli Emperor to Qing forces
Siamese invasion of Lan Na and Tenasserim repelled (to 1664)
China: Siege of Fort Zeelandia: The VOC surrendered Fort Zeelandia on Taiwan to Koxinga.
Cuba: An English fleet captained by Christopher Myngs captures Santiago de Cuba to open up trade with Jamaica.
Russia: Copper Riot: In the early morning, a group of Muscovites marched to Kolomenskoye and demanded punishment for the government ministers who had debased Muscovy's copper currency. On their arrival, they were countered by the military; a thousand were hanged or drowned. The rest were exiled.
Taiwan: Siege of Fort Zeelandia: Fort Zeelandia surrenders to Zheng Chenggong and the Dutch depart from Taiwan; so ends Dutch Formosa
Zheng Chenggong dies and is succeeded by Zheng Xi
Zheng Jing defeats Zheng Xi and renamed his realm the Kingdom of Dongning
